body.name: APEVIA ASTRO450W Astro 450W ATX Power Supply with Auto-Thermally Controlled 120mm Fan, 115/230V Switch, All Protections
body.stockDetail: Only 17 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 57 mins
features: Connectors:1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x 4pin 12V, 3 x SATA, 3 x Peripheral
body.description: Apevia ASTRO450W Astro Series 450W Power Supply. 1 x 20/24pin Main Power/1 x 12V(P4)/3 x SATA/3 x Molex connectors. Auto-Thermally Controlled 120mm Black Fan. 115/230V Switch. 5% Tolerance of 5V, 3.3V & 12V Output. Max. Output Current +3.3V(16A), +5V(16A), +12V(36A), -12V(0.3A), +5Vsb(2.5A). Short-Circuit/Over-Current/Over-Voltage/Over-Power/Under-Voltage/Over-Temperature Protections. For safety, do not overload, abuse or modify the power supply unit. Use of this unit for Bitcoin Mining is not suggested since it will shorten the life and cause failures of power supply. Use for mining purposes is not covered by warranty. NOTE: Ensure that the power cable is connected to the wall outlet + power supply and also the 24/20 pin connector is connected to the motherboard (the power supply will not turn on if only the power cable is connected to the wall outlet and power supply).

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.1 4.1 out of 5 stars 136 ratings 4.1 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good power supply
reviews.reviewText: After my expensive, high end power supply died, I simply do not want to pay that much again. So I choose this and read all one star bad review. Well.. I worried. After it really arrived and installed, I couldn't believe it.. it is actually "better" than the previous EXPENSIVE colorful high end power supply! Believe me, this one is REALLY GOOD.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Blew up on me while I was pulling 27A out of the 12V using a Breakout Board. Not rated for 32A
reviews.reviewText: So I sometimes need to power 5v and 12v fans or battery chargers and I bought this because the price looked good. If I had done some research I would have seen the terrible reputation these have. When it blew up on me I was actually using it to test a boost converter and had a DC clamp meter on the wire running from the boost converter output to the input of a battery. I was charging a scooter battery so I was boosting the voltage from 12v to 42v and taking measurements to test the efficiency of the boost converter. I had the clamp meter measuring output current while I was doing some math and had been pulling 7A for maybe a minute when I heard a loud pop. Upon opening it up I see a bunch of burned out zener diodes. Its probably fixable but doing some math and being generous 7A multiplied by a boost factor of 4 is 28A. Assuming the converter is 90% efficient (its actually 92% or higher) that would be less than 31A. The boost factor is only 3.5 so realistically I was pulling 24.5+2.5=27A.Derate it. It should be listed as a 350W power supply. Seller was kind of willing to work with me when I told them I had zero hope of Apevia making this right but they didn't have much I was interested in (doing some kind of exchange minus the price of the Apevia PSU) so I let it go. The seller gets a good rating, but the product is cheap junk. Sticking with HP Proliant Power Supplies from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good price but beware
reviews.reviewText: Very well made power supply for its price range. couple things i do have to say about this power supply is that1. There is no 6 pin or 8 pin connector. If you are building a PC and hoping to put in a GPU(Graphics Card) Please note that the GPU you are installing doesn't need a 6 pin or 8 pin connector supplying it power and needs to take in power directly from the motherboard. The power supply itself looks like it was only made to give power to the motherboard and no other add-ons that require a 6 or 8 pin connector.Another alternative to counter this is additionally buying a Sata to 6 pin adaptor or 8 pin adaptor if you are looking to install a GPU requiring power directly being supplied into it from the power supply.The power supply has 3 sata ports.another thing I only have to talk about is that the cables come in the mustard yellow, black and red cables in which are not pleasing to the eye and aren't a flat color. but if you dont that and aren't looking to build for looks and are looking for budget and performance this power supply is a good choice

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm stunned with this psu
reviews.reviewText: Perfect upgrade for my sleeper gaming pc. Is super quiet and just enough power for my gpu GT 1030 that pulls power from the board not additional power needed for my gpu. However if you have a GPU with side connector for afditiona power this psu wont suffice because the 8 or 6 pin splits only into sets of 2 making 2x 4pin connectors and in my pc the motherboard requires 4 straight to the board for power besides the 24 pin. So motherboard takes 24 pin plus a 4pin black and yellow leaving with only a spare of 4 pin black and yellow. If you gpu does not require additional power GET THIS PSU!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This was an easy to install works great house at eight 8 PM instead of the normal 4 PM that would go on the motherboard but if you need to 4 PM for this you can only use the 4P and by only plugging in that part of the of the connector and it worked great and it has a 24pin connector it also has 12v molex connectors and sata

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars works as it should
reviews.reviewText: I had a power supply fail on a somewhat aging but still usable PC. Didn't want to spent a lot of money so thought this power supply would fill the bill, and it did. PC booted right up and works fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the price/risk equation
reviews.reviewText: 8hrs in and it's still working as advertised. Out of the box it was a thing a beauty, even the stickers. If the insides are anything like the outside, give it a try and save $$.
